comments:
I just installed Eclipse 3.0 M8 (build 200403261517) w/ CDT 2.0 M8
and wanted to create a new C++ project as described in the CDT FAQ, C/C++
Project Creation, 1. Creating a simple Managed C++ Project -- "Hello World on a
Windows Platform". But there is no C++ project entry to select.

If right-click in C++Projects and select "Other..." and "Show allWizards" is
checked-in I have the possibility to create a new C++ class but it will result
in more java NullException in the logs.

Here's the output of .metadata/.log after two attempts to create a C++ project:

This should be fixed in the latests builds.  There was an M8 build that was 
incomplete and had this behavior.

traces.message: Legacy plug-in "org.eclipse.core.filebuffers" must not be automatically activated on startup. This is probably caused by a previous crash in Eclipse.
